description: FIRE schema for representing bulk collections of bank objects.
title: Batch Schema

___name.description: A unique identifier for the data batch

___count.description: Number of records in this batch

___links.description: An array describing the page structure of the full data batch

___data.description: An array of data items of a single type

$eref.description: An Account represents a financial account that describes the funds that a customer has entrusted to a financial institution in the form of deposits or credit balances.
$eref.title: Account Schema

___minimum_balance_eur.description: Indicates the minimum balance, in Euros, of each account within the aggregate. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___status.description: Describes if the Account is active or been cancelled.

___balance.description: The contractual balance on the date and in the currency given. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal fraamework of the reporting institution.

___customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer that owns the account.

___call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___impairment_status.description: The recognition stage for the impairment/expected credit loss of the product.

___break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

___uk_funding_type.description: Funding type calculated according to BIPRU 12.5

___behavioral_curve_id.description: The unique identifier for the behavioral curve used by the financial institution.

___fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

___rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the account balance in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

___cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

___base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the account.

___encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the account that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___on_balance_sheet.description: Is the account or deposit reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

___purpose.description: The purpose for which the account was created or is being used.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___count.description: Describes the number of accounts aggregated into a single row.

___next_withdrawal_date.description: The next date at which customer is allowed to withdraw money from this account.

___start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the account within the financial institution.

___prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___type.description: This is the type of the account with regards to common regulatory classifications.

___trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___end_date.description: The end or maturity date of the account. Format should be YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

___risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the account resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

___reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

___next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the account will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___currency_code.description: Actual currency of the Account in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

___ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

___withdrawal_penalty.description: This is the penalty incurred by the customer for an early withdrawal on this account. An early withdrawal is defined as a withdrawal prior to the next_withdrawal_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

___country_code.description: Two-letter country code for account location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

___reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

___date.description: The observation or value date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

___accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___arrears_balance.description: The balance of the capital amount that is considered to be in arrears (for overdrafts/credit cards). Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

___rate_type.description: Describes the type of interest rate applied to the account.

___encumbrance_type.description: The type of the encumbrance causing the encumbrance_amount.

___guarantee_amount.description: The amount of the account that is guaranteed under a Government Deposit Guarantee Scheme. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount is the allowance set aside by the firm that accounts for the event that the asset becomes impaired in the future.

___limit_amount.description: The minimum balance the customer can go overdrawn in their account.

___guarantee_scheme.description: The Government Deposit Scheme scheme under which the guarantee_amount is guaranteed.

$eref.description: Data schema to define collateral (currently can reference loans or accounts).
$eref.title: Collateral Schema

___vol_adj.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to the collateral.

___type.description: The collateral type defines the form of the collateral provided

___end_date.description: The end date for recognition of the collateral

___charge.description: Lender charge on collateral, 1 indicates first charge, 2 second and so on. 0 indicates a combination of charge levels.

___encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the collateral that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___vol_adj_fx.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to currency mismatch.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___encumbrance_type.description: The type of the encumbrance causing the encumbrance_amount.

___loan_ids.description: The unique identifiers for the loans within the financial institution.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___start_date.description: The start date for recognition of the collateral

___value_date.description: The timestamp that the collateral was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___account_ids.description: The unique identifier/s for the account/s within the financial institution.

___value.description: The valuation as used by the bank for the collateral on the value_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the collateral within the financial institution.

$eref.description: Data schema to define a customer or legal entity related to a financial product or transaction.
$eref.title: Customer Schema

___status.description: The status of the relationship with the customer from the firm's point of view.

___start_date.description: The date that the customer first became a customer. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___product_count.description: The number of active products/trades this customer has with the firm.

$eref.description: A derivative is a contract which derives its value from an underlying reference index, security or asset.
$eref.title: Derivative Schema

___balance.description: Outstanding amount including accrued interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal framework of the reporting institution.

___customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer for this product.

___call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___implied_vol.description: Options: implied volatility used to compute mtm and greeks.

___notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total value with regard to a derivative's underlying index, security or asset at its spot price in accordance with the specifications (i.e. leverage) of the derivative product. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

___fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

___rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the derivative notional in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

___cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

___base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the financial product.

___initial_margin.description: Upfront margin posted/received for the trade. Monetary type as integer number of cents.

___on_balance_sheet.description: Is the derivative reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

___purpose.description: The purpose for which the derivative is being held.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___underlying_derivative_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference derivative for this derivative.

___start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement for this derivative cash flow.

___next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the derivative within the financial institution.

___underlying_security_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference security for this derivative.

___prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___type.description: This is the type of the derivative with regards to common regulatory classifications.

___underlying_issuer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference issuer for this derivative.

___trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the derivative product resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

___next_receive_amount.description: The amount that is expected to be received at the next_receive_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

___settlement_type.description: The type of settlement for the contract.

___currency_code.description: Actual currency of the underlying reference index, security or asset for the derivative in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

___receive_type.description: The type of the receive leg.

___ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

___theta.description: Price sensitivity with respect to time.

___mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative excluding interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

___value_date.description: The timestamp that the derivative was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative including interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

___date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___next_receive_date.description: The next date at which interest will be received or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___next_reset_date.description: The date on which the periodic payment term and conditions of a contract agreement are reset/re-established.

___first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

___accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___deal_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution for the deal to which this derivative belongs.

___payment_type.description: The type of the payment leg.

___next_exercise_date.description: The next date at which the option can be exercised.

___next_payment_amount.description: The amount that will need to be paid at the next_payment_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___gamma.description: Second-order price sensitivity to the underlying or rate of change of the delta.

$eref.description: A derivative cash flow where two parties exchange cash flows (or assets) derived from an underlying reference index, security or financial instrument.
$eref.title: Derivative Cash Flow Schema

___balance.description: The contractual balance due on the payment date in the currency given. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___trade_date.description: The date that the derivative cash flow terms were agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

___asset_liability.description: A derivative cash flow exchange that results in a net positive value after the transaction is an asset on the firm's balance sheet. A derivative cash flow exchange that results in a net negative value after the transaction is a liability on the firm's balance sheet.

___settlement_type.description: The type of settlement for the contract.

___currency_code.description: Actual currency of the security in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

___mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative cash flow excluding interest/premium/coupons. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total value with regard to a derivative's underlying index, security or asset at its spot price in accordance with the specifications (i.e. leverage) of the derivative product. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

___derivative_id.description: Unique identifier to the derivative to which this cash flow relates

___value_date.description: The timestamp that the cash flow was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative cash flow including interest/premium/coupons. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

___date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest/premium due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___leg.description: The type of the payment leg.

___on_balance_sheet.description: Is the financial product reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

___purpose.description: The purpose for which the derivative cash flow is calculated

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___payment_date.description: The timestamp that the cash flow will occur or was paid. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement for this derivative cash flow.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the derivative within the financial institution.

$eref.description: An Exchange Rate represents the conversion rate between two currencies.
$eref.title: Exchange Rate Schema

___base_currency_code.description: The base currency in accordance with ISO 4217 standards.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___quote.description: The amount of the quote currency received in exchange for 1 unit of the base currency.

___date.description: The observation or value date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the exchange rate within the financial institution.

___quote_currency_code.description: The quoted currency in accordance with ISO 4217 standards.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

$eref.description: Data schema to define a guarantor for a security.
$eref.title: Guarantor Schema

$eref.description: Data schema to define an issuer for a security.
$eref.title: Issuer Schema

$eref.description: Data schema defining the characteristics of a loan product.
$eref.title: Loan Schema

___vol_adj.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to the exposure.

___minimum_balance_eur.description: Indicates the minimum balance, in Euros, of each loan within the aggregate.

___status.description: Describes if the loan is active or been cancelled.

___balance.description: The balance of the loan or capital still to be repaid. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer.

___impairment_status.description: The recognition stage for the impairment/expected credit loss of the product.

___notional_amount.description: The original notional amount of the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___accrued_interest_balance.description: The accrued interest due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

___behavioral_curve_id.description: The unique identifier for the behavioral curve used by the financial institution.

___encumbrance_end_date.description: Date encumbrance amount goes to zero. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

___lnrf_amount.description: The total amount of non-recourse funding linked to the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

___rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the loan balance. Note that for tracker rates this includes the benchmark (ie. not the credit spread). Percentages represented as a decimal/float, so 1.5 implies 1.5%.

___ccf.description: The credit conversion factor that indicates the proportion of the undrawn amount that would be drawn down on default.

___cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

___guarantor_id.description: The unique identifier for the guarantor of the loan.

___repayment_type.description: Repayment type of the loan refers to whether the customer will be repaying capital + interest, just interest or a combination of the two.

___base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the repayment rate on the borrowed funds at the given date as agreed in the terms of the loan.

___encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the loan that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___customers.description: The list of customers for this loan

___income_amount.description: The reference income used for the customer(s) for this loan. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the customer/s within the financial institution.

___on_balance_sheet.description: Is the loan reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

___purpose.description: The underlying reason the borrower has requested the loan.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___count.description: Describes the number of loans aggregated into a single row.

___start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___ref_income_amount.description: The reference income used for the customer(s) for this loan. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

___originator_type.description: The type of financial institution that acted as the originator of the loan product.

___interest_repayment_frequency.description: Repayment frequency of the loan interest, if different from principal.

___next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the loan within the financial institution.

___acc_fv_change_credit_risk.description: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk.

___risk_weight_irb.description: The internal risk weight represented as a decimal/float such that 1.5% is 0.015.

___provision_type.description: The provision type parameter details the provisions the issuing firm has allocated to cover potential losses from issuing a loan.

___prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___type.description: The form of the loan product administered by the financial institution, with regards to common regulatory classifications.

___trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the product resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

___reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

___cum_recoveries.description: The total amount recovered since the date of default of the instrument.

___next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the loan will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___secured.description: Is this loan secured or unsecured?

___provision_amount.description: The amount of reserves that is provisioned by the financial institution to cover the potential loss on the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

___country_code.description: Two-letter country code for product location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

___arrears_arrangement.description: The arrangement the lender has made with the borrower regarding the amount referenced in the arrears_balance.

___reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

___regulated.description: Is this loan regulated or unregulated?

___issuer_id.description: The unique identifier for the issuer of the loan.

___first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

___arrears_balance.description: The balance of the loan or capital amount that is considered to be in arrears. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

___originator_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the originator of the loan product.

___rate_type.description: Describes the type of interest rate applied to the loan.

___risk_weight_std.description: The standardised approach risk weight represented as a decimal/float such that 1.5% is 0.015.

___administration.description: How the loan was administered by the lender.

___guarantee_amount.description: The amount of the loan that is guaranteed by the guarantor. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___impairment_type.description: The loss event resulting in the impairment of the loan.

___impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount for a loan is the allowance for loan impairments set aside by the firm that accounts for the event that the loan becomes impaired in the future.

___facility_currency_code.description: The currency of the credit facility if not the same as loan currency_code.

___movement.description: The movement parameter describes how the loan arrived to the firm.

___limit_amount.description: The total credit limit on the loan. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

$eref.description: A Loan Transaction is an event that has an impact on a loan, typically the balance.
$eref.title: Loan Transaction Schema

___loan_id.description: The unique identifier for the affected loan/s within the financial institution.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___type.description: The type of impact on the balance of the loan.

___value_date.description: The timestamp that the transaction was valued or took place. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___amount.description: The size of the transaction in the loan transaction event. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the loan transaction within the financial institution.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

$eref.description: A security represents a tradable financial instrument held or financed by an institution for investment or collateral.
$eref.title: Security Schema

___status.description: Describes if capital has been paid up or has been called up but not paid for.

___balance.description: Outstanding amount including accrued interest. Monetary integer number of cents/pence.

___hqla_class.description: What is the HQLA classification of this security?

___insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal fraamework of the reporting institution.

___customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer for this product.

___call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___impairment_status.description: The recognition stage for the impairment/expected credit loss of the product.

___asset_liability.description: Is the security (valued at either amortised cost or fair value) an asset or a liability on the firm's balance sheet.

___notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total amount of a security's underlying asset at its spot price. Monetary number of cents.

___cqs_irb.description: The credit quality step for internal ratings based approach.

___break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

___guarantee_start_date.description: The first day the security became guaranteed by the guarantor. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601

___fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

___rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the security notional in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

___cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

___guarantor_id.description: The unique identifier for the guarantor within the financial institution.

___base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the financial product.

___encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the security that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities such as within a repo pool. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___on_balance_sheet.description: Is the security reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

___purpose.description: The purpose for which the security is being held.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___capital_tier.description: The capital tiers based on own funds requirements.

___start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement this security falls under. Typically where used as derivatives collateral.

___next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the security within the financial institution.

___acc_fv_change_credit_risk.description: Accumulated changes in fair value due to credit risk.

___cqs_standardised.description: The credit quality step for standardised approach.

___prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___type.description: This is the type of the security with regards to common regulatory classifications.

___trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the security resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

___reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

___rehypothecation.description: Can the security be rehypothecated by the borrower?

___next_repricing_date.description: The date on which the interest rate of the security will be re-calculated. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___currency_code.description: Actual currency of the security in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

___ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

___mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the security excluding interest. Monetary number of cents/pence.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

___seniority.description: The seniority of the security in the event of sale or bankruptcy of the issuer.

___country_code.description: Two-letter country code for security location/jurisdiction. In accordance with ISO 3166-1.

___value_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the security including interest. Monetary number of cents/pence.

___transferable.description: Can the security be transferred between parties or negotiated on the capital market?

___reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

___date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___issuer_id.description: The unique identifier for the issuer within the financial institution.

___cb_haircut.description: The haircut as determined by the firm's central bank

___first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

___accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as an integer number of cents/pence.

___deal_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the deal for this product that links it to other products of the same or different type.

___acc_fv_change_before_taxes.description: Accumulated change in fair value before taxes.

___isin_code.description: The unique International Securities Identification Number for the security according to ISO 6166.

___impairment_amount.description: The impairment amount for a security is the allowance set aside by the firm for losses.

___movement.description: The movement parameter describes how the security arrived to the firm.

___sft_type.description: The sft_type parameter defines the transaction mechanism conducted for the SFT for this security product.
